title: Leonard leads Spurs over Detroit, 96-92

(AP Photo/Darren Abate) San Antonio Spurs forward LaMarcus Aldridge, rear, shoots against Detroit Pistons' Stanley Johnson (3), Ersan Ilyasova (23) and Andre Drummond during the first half of a preseason NBA basketball game, ... more Photo: Darren Abate, Associated Press Image 9 of 13 2759 x 2018~~$~~Detroit Pistons guard Reggie Jackson, center, prepares to shoot against San Antonio Spurs forward Tim Duncan, left, and Spurs guard Danny Green during the first half of a preseason NBA basketball game, Sunday, Oct. 18, 2015, in San Antonio. 2759 x 2018~~$~~Detroit Pistons guard Reggie Jackson, center, prepares to shoot against San Antonio Spurs forward Tim Duncan, left, and Spurs guard Danny Green during the first half of a preseason NBA ... more Photo: Darren Abate, AP Image 10 of 13 Spurs' LaMarcus Aldridge shoots against Pistons defenders as teammate Tim Duncan looks on during first half action Sunday Oct. 18, 2015 at the AT&T Center. Spurs' LaMarcus Aldridge shoots against Pistons defenders as teammate Tim Duncan looks on during first half action Sunday Oct. 18, 2015 at the AT&T Center. Photo: Edward A. Ornelas, Staff / San Antonio Express-News Image 11 of 13 Spurs' LaMarcus Aldridge (left) jokes with teammate Tim Duncan during first half action against the Pistons Sunday Oct. 18, 2015 at the AT&T Center. Spurs' LaMarcus Aldridge (left) jokes with teammate Tim Duncan during first half action against the Pistons Sunday Oct. 18, 2015 at the AT&T Center. Photo: Edward A. Ornelas, Staff / San Antonio Express-News Image 12 of 13 Spurs' Tim Duncan shoots around Pistons' Andre Drummond during first half action Sunday Oct. 18, 2015 at the AT&T Center. Spurs' Tim Duncan shoots around Pistons' Andre Drummond during first half action Sunday Oct. 18, 2015 at the AT&T Center. Photo: Edward A. Ornelas, San Antonio Express-News Image 13 of 13 Leonard leads Spurs over Detroit, 96-92 1 / 13 Back to Gallery Kawhi Leonard scored 21 points in 28 minutes, leading the Spurs to a 96-92 victory over Detroit on Sunday in their first home game at the refurbished AT&T Center.
Leonard had the bulk of his points in the first half, including 12 in the first quarter alone, as the Spurs led by 15 at the break. They pushed that advantage even further early in the second half before the Pistons rallied late against their deep reserve and camp invites.
RELATED: Newly renovated AT&T Center draws praise as it is shown off for first time
Manu Ginobili added 15 points off the bench, Tim Duncan pulled down 10 rebounds and LaMarcus Aldridge scored nine points on 4-for-14 shooting.
